title: @Meddler  Future of Manamune/Muramana
body:
With New Yorick no longer a viable proponent of Manamune and Muramana, that would leave Urgot, Jayce, Ezreal and, maybe, Varus as the only champions that would reliably build the item.

With such a small part of the champion pool needing access to that item, are there any plans for the eventual removal of the item from the game?

Any thoughts on compensatory buffs to the aforementioned champions, who are so dependent?

replies.body: No, we've no current plans to remove Manamune/Muramana. They are only core on a few champions, which is a downside, they've got an interesting play pattern to them though and through offering delayed power give both an interesting trade off and a pretty healthy form of advantage. It also helps that they're the counterparts to the somewhat more widely used Archangels, so cost of having a low ish item line's somewhat compensated for there too.

Have you guys considered bumping up its mana gain speed a little bit?  Like 6 per charge?  Or even better, give the mana charge a MUCH higher cooldown and an equally increased mana increase so that it'll be attractive on a wider range of champions?

Right now it's 4 per charge with a 3 second cooldown with the ability to stockpile up to two charges, right?  How about bumping that up to a 30 second cooldown and 60 mana per charge?

>
> Have you guys considered bumping up its mana gain speed a little bit?  Like 6 per charge?  

So... you're looking to reduce the charge time by a third?

Not counting the loss of time from deaths and recalling, it currently takes 12 minutes and 32 seconds to fully charge a Muramana from 0 to 750 (if you bought it fully at 2400 gold). Your suggested changes would only take 8 minutes and 36 seconds to get the full item from scratch...  

>Or even better, give the mana charge a MUCH higher cooldown and an equally increased mana increase so that it'll be attractive on a wider range of champions?
> 
> Right now it's 4 per charge with a 3 second cooldown with the ability to stockpile up to two charges, right?  How about bumping that up to a 30 second cooldown and 60 mana per charge?

So, in this instance, it would take 12.5 charges to get a fully charged Muramana from 0.  That's 375 seconds, or just over 6 minutes to get a fully charged weapon.

Kinda puts it in the realm of "must have" for too many champs, doesn't it?
could you at least increase the mana gain per auto/spellcast/manaexpenditure to 6 from 4? Right now it charges WAY too slow compared to Archangels.

Question: Do we gain mana for hitting enemy champions with Muramana? I mean it's consuming mana so wouldn't that count towards Tear's passive?


Also, how would Twisted Fate W E (gold or blue card) interact with Muramana?

Any thoughts on Rageblade? It's pretty much been a Kayle/Kog item only since it got reworked, and given that Kog is getting changed away from being so dependent on on-hit items, it seems like it may end up as a Kayle-only item. Any plans to make it less mediocre for the general on-hit champions?

In particular, do you have any opinion on the AP that rageblade has? I personally think it makes the item incredibly unappealing to a large number of champions who might otherwise like it, and it's certainly not making many AP users love the thing either.

I don't think it would be fair to say that 4 champions is too few to warrent an item. Considering that Riot has no actual reason to remove it. (It's not an abuse item, or had a history of abuse) And it's still have niche champions who depend on it. (Rather than just being a niche item that no one buys.) Lastly, if you adjusted Ez, Jayce, Varus, to scale more with crit chance(to make ER a viable pick) it would likely require them to give up some of their Siege like powers, which they are known for. And in Urgot's case, he actually has a mana ratio. Removing that source of mana could be a problem for him, as it's the only AD item with mana. 

Lastly, even if only 4 or 5 champions fit that model, removing their item just because no one else uses it, completely closes the possibility space for other future champions with a similar model. (AD Poke)

Just making Manamune charge up a fair bit more quickly would probably be enough.  Something like 6 mana per charge rather than 4.  Given the fact that most games are decided by 15 minutes an item that doesn't really kick in until the ~20 minute mark is a HUGE liability.

So you thought Muramana/Manamune needs removing, and you literally ignored the fact that {{item:3056}} is still here.....

One small simple change puts it in the conversation for a lot more champs. Give it a 1% bump in how much AD you get from your mana. At full charge, it could be the highest AD boost in the game, Just as {{item:3003}} can give the biggest AP boost in the game other than {{item:3089}} . It may not have a lot of the other things that could make it sexy to AD champs, but simply having the highest potential AD boost in the game makes it more viable for a broader spectrum of champs. If you had 2000 for your max mana, you would get a total of 85 AD, rather than the current 65 AD total. If you are hitting a measly once per second that is a flat 20 dps before armor. Most champs with this item are likely to get closer to the 1.5 or higher attack speed range, increasing the effect even further.

Potential to make it much more sexy (imo)? Simple. Take the Shock effect of {{item:3042}} and bump the damage to 10% of current mana, but make it only go off every other hit. Again using the example above of 2000 max mana, you would go down to 1940 on hit and do 116 extra damage currently. That goes up to 194 extra damage if you bump it to 10%, but you only get it every other hit. Say you are attacking 1.5 times per second, not out of the question, and you use no abilities between six attacks. Currently those six hits would be (in 4 seconds) 116 bonus, 113, 109, 106, 103, 100 for a total of 647 damage (161.75 dps), and you would be down to 1665 mana (83.5 mana consumed per second). With the bump, you would be looking at 194, 188, 183 for a total of 565 damage (141.25 dps) and have 1826 (43.5 mana consumed per second) mana remaining. Overall you lose 13% of the abilities dps, but use about half as much mana to do said damage. This leaves you far more mana for using your abilities (which are going to do more to boost your dps than basic attacks anyway) at a fairly insignificant reduction of your dps when you look at the big picture. Also if the change to the attack damage boost above was made as well, you lose no dps, but greatly reduce the mana consumption of the item's ability. 

It would wind up scaling faster than the current model as you bought more mana boosting items. I admit, it would still be a bit of a niche item for the more mana hungry ranged attackers and hybrid champs, but I think this would be a good rework of the item, and cause it to see more play, what do you guys think?
